results.title: Paddington goes to the movies (K)
results.creator_credit: Barry Leith, Graham Clutterbuck, FilmFair Communications and Paddington
results.brief_description: Paddington is caught in a storm and shelters in the entrance of a cinema where he discovers that “Singing in the Rain” starring Gene Kelly is screening. Being an unaccompanied bear under 16, Paddington is not allowed in. However, he manages to peer through a keyhole and catches his first glimpse of the world of the silver screen. Unfortunately, in typical Paddington fashion, he also wreaks havoc in the theatre and the projection box. On his way home, in the excitement of the moment, Paddington tries to emulate the dancing of Gene Kelly. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington goes to the movies
results.creator_credit: Barry Leith, Graham Clutterbuck, FilmFair Communications and Paddington
results.brief_description: Paddington is caught in a storm and shelters in the entrance of a cinema where he discovers that “Singing in the Rain” starring Gene Kelly is screening. Being an unaccompanied bear under 16, Paddington is not allowed in. However, he manages to peer through a keyhole and catches his first glimpse of the world of the silver screen. Unfortunately, in typical Paddington fashion, he also wreaks havoc in the theatre and the projection box. On his way home, in the excitement of the moment, Paddington tries to emulate the dancing of Gene Kelly. Narrated by Michael Hordern and based on the book by Michael Bond. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington for Prime Minister; Fishing for Paddington; Expedition Paddington
results.brief_description: Three animated stories about Paddington Bear. Paddington decides that he will toss his floppy hat into the political arena in “Paddington for Prime Minister”. Next, it’s off to the seaside in “Fishing for Paddington”. Then, only Paddington could turn a simple Brown family outing into a raging three ring circus in “Expedition Paddington”. Based on the beloved books by Michael Bond and features the voice of Tim Curry. All episodes are written by Bruce Morris with the exception of “Fishing for Paddington” which was written by Gordon Kent.

results.title: Paddington cleans up (K)
results.brief_description: Adapted from Chapter 2 from the book “Paddington on Top” by Michael Bond. Charming animated tale about neighbourhood free-loader, Mr Curry, plotting to have Paddington clean his house for free. However his plans come unstuck when Paddington is unable to locate a power point for his vacuum cleaner.

results.title: Pacific: the island to island war & the bomb
results.brief_description: In twenty-six parts. “The World at War” series tells the story of World War II. Part 23. The Allied Pacific offensive came under the command of two rivals; General Macarthur sweeps upward from the Solomon Islands and New Guinea to the Philippines, and Admiral Nimitz leaps from island to island starting in November 1943 in the Gilbert Islands at Tarawa. Heavy casualties awaited the Americans in their attack. Part 24. On August 1945, an American B-59 bomber, The “Enola Gay”, named after the mother of the pilot, Paul Tibbets, droped the world’s first uranium bomb on the city of Hiroshima. Four days latter a second bomb was dropped on Nagasaki.

results.title: Pacific Island life: village life
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Part of a series of five films which examine aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Shows daily life in the village, including the building of a home.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Pacific Island life: food from the sea
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Shows the lagoon being searched for clams, sea-worms, crabs and turtles. A coconut crab is caught and cooked in an open fire and the shell is used as a container, tool or toy. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Pacific Island life: fishing
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Shows the men preparing for the catch by trapping small fish in the lagoon which they then take beyond the coral reef at the mouth of the channel and use as bait to attract the larger bait. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Pacific Island life: family life
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Each family has its own field usually on one of the more fertile islands. Teheilau and his family take a boat trip to attend to their plot where they grow taro and tumeric. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
